puzzle.title: Tar Trivia
puzzle.hint: Notice that "suitable" is emphasized.
Each "sailing fact" contains the name of a playing card suit...almost.
The first fact contains "Club" but it is spelled "dlub".
Once you have all the suits found, perhaps do something with the wrong letter.
The solution is DECKHAND.

puzzle.title: Clubs
puzzle.hint: Can you make a common phrase out of each box?
Add one to "Hole in" to make "Hole in One"
You should be able to make a phrase of each boxe by adding one, two, three, or four
Notice how the boxes with the same number are kind of together?
Each group will make a letter on the "dance floor"
Order the letters by the numbers (1,2,3,4)
ANSWER: LEFT

puzzle.title: Diamonds
puzzle.hint: Once you find all of the items, place in alpha order in the grid.
Notice the gray boxes. Anything interesting about them?
Too bad there aren't 26 gray boxes to complete the set.
Find the missing letters of the alphabet from the gray boxes. For example "H" is missing
ANSWER HUNT

puzzle.title: Hearts
puzzle.hint: Notice that the first letter of girls names. It provides an instruction.
Find in each peson's quote the five letter word (there is only one per quote).
Any way you can match a guy to a gal using that 5 letter word? Is there anything similar between them?
Andrea's "petal" goes with Ichabod's "ideal". They each share 4 letters.
With the unmatched letters you should be able to spell out a 16 letter phrase.
PARTIAL ANSWER: PLENTY OF IN THE SEA
ANSWER: FISH

puzzle.title: Spades
puzzle.hint: Find the hidden codings in the image
The codings are: Pigpen, morse, braille, and semaphore.
FINAL ANSWER: SOLE

puzzle.title: Gin? Rum? (meta puzzle)
puzzle.hint: Player 1 should end up with 2 Clubs,3 Spades,4 Hearts,5 Diamonds with should spell "LOST"
Player 2 will have 10 Hearts,Jack of Diamonds,Queen of Clubs,King of Diamonds = "INTH"
ANSWER: LOST IN THE SHUFFLE
